title: Cybersecurity for Management | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: This 3-day workshop helps cybersecurity professionals understand national-level cyber strategies and legal governance in combatting cyber threats.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
This 3-day workshop helps cybersecurity professionals understand national-level cyber strategies and legal governance in combatting cyber threats.
Cybersecurity is gaining prominence at the highest government levels in many countries.

These countries, in turn, need to formulate holistic and sensible cyber strategies at the national level, to deal with cyber threats, ranging from state-sponsored players to rogue private corporations and individuals.

This 3-day workshop seeks to prepare cybersecurity professionals, especially those in managerial positions in understanding the relationship between cyber warfare and war strategies; various national cyber strategies that are presently being employed by countries, and the role of legal governance in cyberwar.
Directors of companies and senior management members responsible for cybersecurity, information technology, human resources, risk management, corporate compliance and finance; or
Information security, forensic investigators, analysts, auditors, accountants, and corporate compliance and risk management professionals; cybersecurity researchers; or
Members of the Armed Forces and law enforcement professionals involved in cybersecurity
University degree or at least 2 years of working experience
Understand the role of war strategy and their application to cyberwars
Appreciate the different players in cyberwars from state-sponsored players to private corporations and the different approaches in national cyber strategies
Understand the role of legal regimes in response to cyberwar
Associate Lecturer, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Lecturer, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology

Prior to being called to the Singapore Bar, KK worked in diverse areas such as legal policy research, technology standards, data privacy and protection and information security consulting in both the public and private sectors. He is the inaugural chapter author of Singapore in Global Privacy & Security Law, Wolters Kluwer and contributed to Global Privacy Advisors, the newsletter of the International Association of Privacy Professionals (IAPP). He holds a Bachelor of Arts in Government and Psychology from the University of Texas at Austin a Bachelor of Laws from Monash Law School, Australia and the Master of Laws from The National University of Singapore. He also completed numerous professional certifications in audit and systems security. He is a member of the Singapore Bar, an Accredited Mediator and Chair of the Cybersecurity and Data Protection Committee of the Law Society of Singapore from 2016 to 2019.
Introduction to the theories and causes of wars by examining key strategy thinkers such as Clausewitz and Sun Tzu amongst others and their applications to cyberwarfare
The emergency of information-centric warfare, the role of psychological operations (PSYOPS) and the role of technology in cyberwars
The cybersecurity strategy of big powers such as the United States and China
Singapore’s Cyber Security Strategy and Legal Governance Framework such as the Cybersecurity Act (2018) and Personal Data Protection Act (2012)
A Certificate of Participation will be issued to participants who
Attend at least 75% of the course
Undertake and pass non-credit bearing assessment during the course
The full fee for this course is S$3,270.00
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
Learn more about funding schemes available
The Learn for Life token may be used for this course
There are no upcoming course runs at the moment.
Subscribe to our mailing list to learn about the latest dates as soon as they become available.
Are there any technical skill needed as a prerequisite?
No technical skill or pre-qualification is needed as there is no laboratory requirements but you must at least not be adverse to the topic on cybersecurity at large.
The assessments will include a mixture of tutorial participation and MCQ.
What is the basic qualification to apply?
University degree of in discipline or 2 years of working experience. But note that you should be ready to spend time reading up before class in order to benefit maximally from the class discussions.
Can I apply if I have a Polytechnic diploma?
Yes, but you will need to have at least 2 years of working experience.
Is this a part time or full time course?
Must I be in the Infocomm Technology industry to apply?
No, but you must be interested at least in cybersecurity at the minimum.
Can I join in the class just to audit without taking any assessment?
As SSG funding is available, all eligible participants are required to participate in the assessments.
SIT Partners MINDEF to Offer Cyber NSF Scheme

Minister for Education (Higher Education and Skills) and Second Minister for Defence Ong Ye Kung officiated at the signing of a work-learn Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) between the Ministry of Defence (MINDEF)’s Defence Cyber Organisation (DCO) and the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT) on 12 February 2018. The MOU was signed by Defence Cyber Chief Mr David Koh and Professor Loh Han Tong, Deputy President (Academic) and Provost, SIT.
The recent outbreak of WannaCry affected more than 200,000 individuals in over 150 countries, including Singapore.
Information Security Risk Management and Audit

Specialised micro-credential for strong technical and theoretical expertise in information systems audit, security management, and risk management based on Agile. Earn a Specialist Certificate and stack it towards a degree in Applied Computing.
Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Applied Computing (via the CSM Pathway)
Information Security, Cybersecurity, Risk Management, Audit, Competency-based Education
This specialised micro-credential covers key areas in information security, cryptography fundamentals, security analytics and real-world applications.
Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Applied Computing (via the CSM Pathway)
Workshop on the Fundamentals of IoT Forensics
Learn IoT forensics to extract firmware from devices and prevent critical, life-threatening malware attacks in a 2-day workshop.
AI and Machine Learning, Cybersecurity, Internet of Things
This specialised micro-credential imparts cloud computing skills, covering architecture, big data analytics, and security.
Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Applied Computing (via the CSM Pathway)
Cloud Computing, Cybersecurity, Computer Architecture, Competency-based Education
